author: Special Correspondent
text:
Jayashree Muralidharan, Registrar of Cooperative Societies, on Saturday inspected the Primary Agricultural Credit Society at Venmani village here, where a gang of dacoits murdered its secretary and looted jewellery estimated at Rs. 3 crore.

Accompanied by the officials, she visited the society and verified the accounts and documents. She enquired with the staff members of the society, civil supplies and cooperative department officials of the district on the circumstances that led to the murder and looting.

She met the kin and kith of murdered Kamaraj of Irinjiyur and consoled them. Later, she handed over a cheque for about Rs. 6.74 lakh.

Terming the incident as “painful and unfortunate”, Ms. Muralidharan told The Hindu that Mr. Kamaraj had been honest and sincere in his duty. The verification of accounts revealed that he had maintained the accounts very well. He had made all entries till the evening of Thursday.
title: Registrar meets kin of slain PACS employee
